answers.answer: hi i also have pcos been ttc for a year now the metformin is good because i gained about 40lbs when i found out i had it and now i have lost a lot of weight so thats good the only thing is that clomid has not done anything for me. Everyone is different and meds work differently some fast others slow. I was not ovulating for a while and didn't even know so had to take provera but after a while of taking meds ur system will regulate. Good luck to u.

I don't really have any advice on the OPK's from any experience of mine.  They were a PITA for me.  However, DH's niece has PCOS and had post OPK's, but then went for an u/s and there was nothing there.  So yes, it can give you a false positive.As for the Metaformin, no, you do not need AF to start it.  The Clomid yes, but Metaformin is a medication that treats diabetes and sugar/insulin problems.   I don't know why they told you that.  Like I said, you have build up on the dosage, so the sooner the better :)Hope this helps....let me know if you have any other questions.April
